auth.unableToSignIn: Unable to sign in with those credentials.
auth.enterEmailOrUsername: Enter the email address or username associated with your account.
auth.ifAccountExists: If the account exists, a reset email has been sent.

auth.canNowSignIn: You can now sign in with your new password.
auth.chooseNewPasswordToContinue: Choose a new password to continue to your account.
auth.passwordChangedSuccessfully: Your password has been changed successfully.

dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.description: Manage your servers and recent activity from one place.

profile.title: Profile

security.title: Security
security.description: Harden your account with strong passwords and multifactor authentication.

password.title: Password
password.description: Update your password to keep your account secure.
password.passwordStrengthHint: Use at least 12 characters with a mix of letters, numbers, and symbols.
password.passwordMinLength: Password must be at least 12 characters.
password.passwordLooksGood: Looks good! Make sure it is unique to XyraPanel.
password.passwordResetExplanation: Your password needs to be updated before you can return to the panel.
password.passwordResetNextSteps: Choose a new password below. You'll regain access as soon as the update succeeds.

twoFactor.title: Two-factor authentication
twoFactor.description: Protect your account with TOTP-compatible authenticator apps (Google Authenticator, 1Password, etc.).
twoFactor.disableFirst: You need to disable it first if you want to reconfigure your authenticator.
twoFactor.enterPasswordToEnable: Enter your password to enable two-factor authentication.
twoFactor.scanQRCode: Scan the QR code with your authenticator app and enter the 6-digit code to confirm.
twoFactor.confirmPasswordToStart: Confirm your password to start two-factor authentication setup
twoFactor.scanQROrUseSecret: Scan this QR code or use the secret below.
twoFactor.enterCodeFromAuthenticator: Enter the code from your authenticator app
twoFactor.keepRecoveryTokens: Keep your recovery tokens in a safe location.
twoFactor.saveCodesSecurely: Save these codes in a secure password manager. Each token can be used once.
twoFactor.twoFactorActive: Two-factor authentication is active. You'll be prompted for a 6-digit code (or recovery token) on new logins.
twoFactor.confirmPasswordToDisable: Confirm your password to disable two-factor authentication
twoFactor.startSetupFirst: Start the setup process before verifying.
twoFactor.enter6DigitCodeFromApp: Enter the 6-digit code from your authenticator app.

apiKeys.title: API Keys
apiKeys.description: Manage API keys for programmatic access to your account.
apiKeys.keyCreatedDescription: Copy your API key now. You won't be able to see it again.
apiKeys.keyDeletedDescription: The API key has been removed from your account.
apiKeys.allowedIPsHelp: Leave empty to allow from any IP. Enter IPv4 addresses separated by commas.

apiKeys.generatePersonalAPIKey: Generate a personal API key for programmatic access
apiKeys.wontSeeAgainAfterClose: You won't be able to see it again after closing this dialog.
apiKeys.friendlyNameHelp: A friendly name to help identify this key
apiKeys.commaSeparatedIPsHelp: Comma-separated list of IPv4 addresses. Leave empty to allow all IPs.

sessions.manageSessions: View and manage all active sessions for your account.

sessions.confirmRevokeSession: Are you sure you want to revoke this session? You'll be signed out on that device.
sessions.confirmRevokeAll: Are you sure you want to revoke all other sessions? You'll be signed out on all other devices.

sessions.sessionRevokedDescription: The selected session has been signed out.
sessions.sessionsRevokedDescription: All other sessions have been revoked.

sshKeys.confirmDeleteSSHKey: Are you sure you want to delete this SSH key? This action cannot be undone.

sshKeys.keyAddedDescription: Your SSH key has been added successfully

api.activeKeysDescription: Manage existing keys or create new ones for API access.

servers.title: Servers
servers.description: Manage all servers in the panel.
servers.noServersFoundDescription: No servers match your search criteria.

delete.title: Delete server
delete.description: Deleting a server removes its panel metadata. This does not automatically delete data from Wings.
delete.serverDeletedDescription: The server has been removed from the panel.
delete.failedToDeleteServer: Unable to delete the selected server.
delete.confirmDeleteServer: Are you sure you want to delete {name}?

manage.title: Management
manage.dangerZoneDescription: Sensitive or destructive actions for this server live here. Proceed carefully.
manage.serverUnsuspendedDescription: The server is now accessible to the user again.
manage.serverSuspendedDescription: The server has been suspended and is no longer accessible to the user.
manage.confirmReinstall: Reinstall this server? This will stop it and reinstall from the egg.
manage.reinstallQueued: The server reinstall has been queued.
manage.confirmCreateOnWings: Create and install this server on Wings now?

manage.failedToCreateOnWings: Unable to create the server on Wings.
manage.serverDeletedDescription: The server has been scheduled for deletion.
manage.unsuspendServerDescription: Restore access for the owner and resume billing.
manage.suspendServerDescription: Temporarily block this server from running.
manage.createInstallServerOnWingsDescription: Kick off the Wings installation workflow if this server previously failed.
manage.reinstallServerDescription: Re-run the egg's install scripts for this server.
manage.transferServerDescription: Move this server to another node and allocation.
manage.deleteServerDescription: Permanently delete this server and all related data.
manage.serverTransferDescription: Move the server to a new node and allocation. Transfers may take several minutes.
manage.targetNodePlaceholder: Node ID, UUID, or short code
manage.targetNodeHelp: Enter the node that should receive this server after transfer completes.
manage.primaryAllocationHelp: Specify the primary allocation for the destination node, or leave blank to auto-select.
manage.additionalAllocationsHelp: Optional list of extra allocations to attach after the transfer completes.
manage.startServerAfterTransferDescription: Automatically power on the server once the transfer is finished.

create.title: Create New Server
create.subtitle: Follow the steps below to create a new game server.
create.serverNameHelp: A friendly name to identify this server in the panel.
create.serverOwnerHelp: Choose the panel user who will own this server.
create.selectNestHelp: Nests group eggs for specific games or software.
create.selectEggHelp: Eggs define the game or software this server will run.
create.selectNodeHelp: Nodes are physical or virtual machines that run servers.
create.noNodesAvailableDescription: You need at least one Wings node online before creating servers.
create.memoryHelp: Amount of RAM allocated to the server in megabytes.
create.diskSpaceHelp: Total disk space allocated to this server in megabytes.
create.cpuLimitHelp: Maximum CPU usage allowed for this server, as a percentage.
create.ioWeightHelp: Relative IO weight used by the scheduler. Higher means more disk priority.
create.cpuThreadsHelp: Optional CPU pinning mask; leave blank to allow all cores.
create.oomKillerHelp: When enabled, prevents the kernel from killing this server when out of memory.
create.primaryAllocationHelpSelectNode: Select a node first to see available allocations.
create.primaryAllocationHelpNoAllocations: No free allocations are available on this node.
create.primaryAllocationHelp: Choose the primary IP and port used for this server.
create.noAvailableAllocationsDescription: This node has no free allocations configured.
create.startupCommandHelp: Override the default startup command from the egg, if needed.
create.reviewConfigurationDescription: Double-check the server owner, resources, and allocations before creating.

nodes.title: Nodes
nodes.description: Manage Wings nodes connected to the panel.
nodes.noNodesLinked: No nodes linked yet. Register a Wings node to begin managing infrastructure.
nodes.registerNodeDescription: Connect a Wings node so you can schedule servers on it from the panel.
nodes.nodeDescriptionPlaceholder: Optional description or notes for this node
nodes.baseURLHelp: Public URL Wings exposes (e.g. https://wings.example.com). Must be reachable from the panel.
nodes.apiTokenHelp: Optional existing Wings token. If omitted, the panel will mint one for you.
nodes.confirmRemoveNode: Remove this node from the panel? Servers will remain assigned but node actions will be disabled.
nodes.configurationDownloadBrowserOnly: Downloading a Wings configuration is only available in a browser context.
nodes.runOnWingsHost: Run this command on the Wings host {name} ({id}).
nodes.includesWingsConfigureFlags: Includes the necessary wings configure flags:
nodes.setToFreshlyIssuedToken: set to the freshly issued token
nodes.systemInformationModalDescription: Real-time system snapshot fetched directly from the Wings API.
nodes.fetchedFromWingsAPI: Fetched directly from the Wings API.
nodes.nodeSyncedDescription: Wings daemon successfully synced with the panel.
nodes.transferServersDescription: Move selected servers to another node and update their allocations.
nodes.serverTransferDescription: Select the destination node and servers you want to move.
nodes.chooseNodeToTransferServersTo: Choose the node that should receive these servers.
nodes.createAllocationsDescription: Generate multiple allocations at once by specifying IPs and ports.
nodes.bulkCreationIpAddresses: One IP address per line (supports CIDR ranges).
nodes.bulkCreationPorts: One port or port range per line (e.g. 25565-25570).
nodes.bulkCreationCidrRange: CIDR notation expands to every address in the block.
nodes.bulkCreationPortRange: Port ranges expand inclusively (max 1,000 ports per range).
nodes.ipAddressOrCidrHelp: Enter a single IP or CIDR block. Add additional IPs on new lines.
nodes.portsHelp: Comma-separated ports or ranges between 1024 and 65535.
nodes.ipAliasHelp: Optional friendly label shown alongside this allocation.

settings.nodeNamePlaceholder: Nodes are usually named after their location, e.g. CA-1
settings.descriptionPlaceholder: Optional notes or details about this node
settings.publicNodeDescription: Allow this node to appear when creating or transferring servers.
settings.maintenanceModeDescription: Suspend scheduling on this node while you perform maintenance.
settings.behindProxyDescription: Enable if the daemon is behind a proxy so generated commands omit TLS flags.

nodes.noServersForNodeYet: No servers on this node yet.

locations.title: Locations
locations.description: Group nodes by physical or logical locations.

locations.confirmDelete: Delete location {short}? Nodes assigned here will not be affected.
locations.shortCodeHelp: 2–8 characters used throughout the panel (e.g. NYC1, EU-West).
locations.longNameHelp: Optional friendly name shown to admins and users.

nests.title: Nests
nests.description: Group eggs for similar server types.

nests.descriptionPlaceholder: Optional summary of what this nest contains.

createEgg.startupCommandHelp: Command executed to start servers created from this egg.
createEgg.eggJsonFileHelp: Select an exported egg JSON file to import.

settings.title: Settings
settings.subtitle: Configure panel settings and preferences
settings.noSettingsAvailableDescription: There are no settings sections available for your account. Contact an administrator if you believe this is an error.

generalSettings.title: General Settings
generalSettings.paginationLimitDescription: Default number of items per page in admin lists.
generalSettings.paginationLimitInt: Pagination limit must be a whole number
generalSettings.paginationLimitMin: Pagination limit must be at least 10

securitySettings.sessionTimeoutMin: Session timeout must be at least 5 minutes
securitySettings.sessionTimeoutMax: Session timeout cannot exceed 1440 minutes (24 hours)

securitySettings.queueConcurrencyMin: Queue concurrency must be at least 1

securitySettings.queueRetryLimitMin: Queue retry limit must be at least 1
